Immediate management focuses on patient safety and symptom stabilization, while long-term strategies involve ongoing medication titration, psychotherapy, and substance counseling. Clear patient education emphasizes the importance of adherence, lifestyle changes, and avoiding triggers. Coordination with mental health specialists and support resources will enhance sustained recovery, aiming for symptom reduction, improved functioning, and prevention of recurrence.
